entry.title: PMDG Updates 777-300ER for MSFS
entry.summary: Sim: MSFS. PMDG has recently issued a new update to their newly released Boeing 777-300ER for Microsoft Flight Simulator, bringing a few more fixes to the WASM issues, sound tweaks, and news on future updates for the DC-6 and 737s.Â In an unusual fashion, the forum post begins with a paragraph on a future DC-6 update, which will improve texture clarity on gauges and dials and many of the placards and indicators throughout the flight deck. The update stems from what they have learned with the 737 and 777, which were initially applied on an experimental basis but were deemed too good to be kept private. The following bit details an SU15-induced issue that led to the aircraft freezing entirely, although the simulator would keep running. They claim it has to do with changes in how the platform handles C++ code issues that otherwise wouldnât cause crashes. PMDG has been working hard to find and mitigate the triggers to provide maximum stability.Â Said fixes are being rolled out gradually on the 777 and will also be rolled out to the 737 in due time. A beta version has been pushed out to their testers so they can ensure itâs working fine before a full rollout. PMDG is confident that update 2.00.0037 will give the 777 stability and protection against the SU15 issues that were unmasked with the help of their testers and customers. They have found most of the root causes and dealt with them accordingly.Â With that being said, their âguard is still up,â and bug reports are still being constantly evaluated, with more fixes on the way.Â The next update is already being worked on, and itâs anticipated to include a fix for the long filenames problem and a potential new feature: Navigraph data might be updated through the Ultimate Flight Tablet. Other fixes are also pending. The changelog for todayâs update follows below: â The 777-300ER is available on PMDG.com for $77.73. Stay tuned to Threshold for more flight simulation news! â

entry.title: Orbx Updates DCS Kola Map with New Features
entry.summary: Sim: DCS. Orbx has released a new update for its Kola map for DCS. The update includes new features and improvements. The main feature of the update is a set of winter textures, allowing users to explore the harsh and cold climate of the North. Further improvements to the map have been made based on community feedback. The update includes new winter textures that accurately represent cold climates. These textures will be adjusted based on the date of the mission. Additionally, the update features the Port of Kirkenes and includes enhancements within the Russian/Finnish border. Based on community feedback, the new update includes several improvements. These include performance optimizations, corrected placement of wind turbines, removal of orange trees from fields, and increased depth of the Polyarny harbor. All these improvements have been made to ensure that the map is as accurate as possible. The updated add-on is currently available on Orbx for $57.66 during early access and will increase to $69.99 upon full release. â For the latest flight simulation news, remember to stay tuned on Threshold!

entry.title: Parallel 42 Releases 777 Immersion Pack for MSFS
entry.summary: Sim: MSFS. Parallel 42 recently released their 777 Immersion package for Microsoft Flight Simulatorâpart of their SimFX add-onâaiming to improve the overall realism of the effects for the PMDG 777 (and CaptainSim, eventually) with condensation, realistic chemtrails, brake smoke, and more. Available as a single package for all major renditions of the triple seven airframe regardless of the livery used, bringing immersive effects for the PMDG and CaptainSim (at a later date) and customized for each with performance as their top priority.Â Built on the SimFx framework, it offers the best combination of effects and customizability via the SimFx interface. For the unaware, Parallel 42âs SimFX is a visual effects utility covering a range of immersive scenarios. Environmental variables and formulas authentically govern every particle on the screen, and dynamic effects appear under the right conditions, creating unique moments in the virtual skies. The effects include contrails, heat blurs, wing wash, rotor wash, and more. Their immersion package for the 777 builds on top of what SimFx already offers, bringing nineteen custom effects for the mighty triple seven, including swirling contrails, condensation effects, waste water drain every hour, engine cold start effects, fuel jettison, cloud illumination, hot brakes smoke, carbon brake dust, and water droplets. The APU heat blur and the St. Elmoâs fire are not supported because of a development choice by PMDG, using a deprecated technique preventing SimFX or 777 Immersion from injecting their version of those effects. The package is available on Contrail for roughly $15.00, requiring at least 2 MB of free hard disk space to install. Bear in mind that the 777 Package requires SimFX to work. Stay tuned to Threshold for more flight simulation news! â

entry.title: Cli4D Designs Releases Moorea, French Polynesia for MSFS
entry.summary: Sim: MSFS. Cli4D Designs has recently released its latest add-on for Microsoft Flight Simulator, focusing on the island of Moorea. Situated in French Polynesia, Moorea is surrounded by the Pacific Ocean. This add-on enhances the area originally created by Asobo and Microsoft, aiming to capture the island's breathtaking beauty. Moorea is a volcanic island with about 18.000 residents, located roughly 11 miles northwest of Tahiti. Although it covers only 52 square miles, the island boasts stunning visuals, including the coastal area and the extinct volcano Mount Tohivea, providing users with plenty to explore. The newly released add-on is loaded with features, offering an enhanced coastal area with tropical vegetation, human models, custom buildings with PBR textures, stationary and moving boats, improved ground textures, as well as enhancements on the hills and mountains, numerous points of interest, and more. The Moorea add-on from Cli4D Designs requires 3.68 GB of storage space and is available on Orbx, SimMarket, and Contrail for around $13.00. â For the latest flight simulation news, remember to stay tuned on Threshold!

entry.title: ThirdWind Simulations Announce Feiseler Storch
entry.summary: Sim: MSFS. Thirdwind Simulations, a new collaborative venture between veteran developer Nervegas and flight sim content creator BurstixTV, has announced its first project: the Fieseler Fi 156 Storch. The announcement was made on the MSFS forums and featured a preview of the current 3d model being shown in Blender. The Storch was a liaison aircraft developed for the German Ministry of Aviation in the 1930s. The original aircraft was powered by an Argus V8 engine and had a range of 210nm at a cruise speed of 81 knots. The Storch was retired by the German military but went on to serve with French forces until the 70s. For more information on the Storch project by Thirdwind Simulations, you can check out their discord here. â Stay tuned to Threshold for the latest in flight simulation! â

entry.title: FSDG Releases Hurghada International Airport for X-Plane 12
entry.summary: Sim: X-Plane. FSDG has recently released its latest scenery for X-Plane 12, Hurghada International Airport (HEGN). Located in and serving the city of Hurghada, Egypt, the airport is one of the busiest in the Middle East. The airport serves as an important hub for a variety of leisure flights coming from Europe. Hurghada International Airport began operating in 1977. Over the years, it has expanded and is now the second busiest airport in Egypt, after Cairo International Airport. The airport consists of two terminals: Terminal 1 and Terminal 2. It is situated just 3.1 miles southwest of Hurghada's city center. Air Cairo considers the airport a focus city, and it serves many other airlines year-round as well as seasonally, including Corendon Airlines, easyJet, TUI Airways, and Wizz Air. The airport's diverse airline operations contribute to a significant influx of visitors from across Europe to the city of Hurghada. The new scenery for X-Plane 12 includes a fully accurate rendition of Hurghada International Airport and its surroundings, an updated airport layout, several hotels, resorts, and landmarks, dynamic lighting, animated jetways, and more. The newly released Hurghada International Airport scenery is now available on FSDG for around $21.87. â For the latest flight simulation news, remember to stay tuned on Threshold!

entry.title: Velocity SkyTech Releases Bournemouth Airport for MSFS
entry.summary: Sim: MSFS. Velocity SkyTech has recently released its rendition of Bournemouth Airport (EGHH) for Microsoft Flight Simulator. The airport is located just 4 miles away from Bournemouth, England, and is an international airport that serves a variety of destinations, particularly warm and summer destinations. The airport first opened as a Royal Air Force station, called RAF Hurn, in 1941. In 1944, it was transferred to civil control and even served as London's international airport before the opening of Heathrow in 1946. Over the years, the airport has served a variety of airlines and destinations, growing to its current state. Last year, the airport served just over 950.000 passengers and had over 5000 aircraft movements. It is the focus city for Jet2.com, Ryanair, and TUI Airways, and also serves airlines like easyJet, offering flights to destinations including France, Greece, and Spain. The newly released Bournemouth Airport add-on for Microsoft Flight Simulator comes with several features, such as exterior and interior 3D modeling of the terminal buildings, PBR textures, performance optimization, and more. The add-on requires 375.07 MB of storage space and is currently on sale on SimMarket for approximately $13.02. â For the latest flight simulation news, remember to stay tuned on Threshold!
